t: “Even*pn today my complaint is bitter; My*ld hand is listless because of my groaning.
Oh,*ld that I knew where I might find Him, That*ild I might come to His seat!
I*ld would present my*i case before Him, And*ld fill my mouth with arguments.
I*ld would know the words which*i He would answer me, And*ld understand what He would say to me.
Would*ld He contend with me in His great power? No!*ld But He would take note*i of me.
There*ld the upright could reason with Him, And*ld I would be delivered forever from my Judge.
“Look,*ln I go forward, but He is not there,*i And*ld backward, but I cannot perceive Him;
When*ld He works on the left hand, I cannot behold Him;*i When*ld He turns to the right hand, I cannot see Him.*i
But*ld He knows the way that I take; When*ild He has tested me, I shall come forth as gold.
My*ld foot has held fast to His steps; I*ld have kept His way and not turned aside.
I*ld have not departed from the commandment of His lips; I*ld have treasured the words of His mouth More*ld than my necessary food.*i
“But*ln He is*i unique, and who can make Him change? And*ld whatever*i His soul desires, that*i He does.
For*ld He performs what*i is*i appointed for me, And*ld many such things*i are*i with Him.
Therefore*ld I am terrified at His presence; When*ld I consider this,*i I am afraid of Him.
For*ld God made my heart weak, And*ld the Almighty terrifies me;
Because*ld I was not cut off from the presence of darkness, And*ld He did not*i hide deep darkness from my face.
